meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny!

I'm back with another review that's sure to make you laugh and maybe even convince you to play LEGO Marvel Super Heroes 2 (LMHS2). I know what you're thinking: "Why should I care about a game with such a silly name?" Well, let me tell you, this game is the real deal. It's a superhero romp that brings together some of the most iconic characters from the Marvel universe in one epic adventure.

Now, I know what you're thinking: "Hasn't this reviewer played enough LEGO games already?" And to that, I say... guilty as charged! But honestly, who can resist the charm of those little plastic bricks? They're like a never-ending treasure trove of nostalgia and fun. And LMHS2 is no exception.

So, what's new with this installment? Not a whole lot, if I'm being honest. It's more of the same: colorful visuals, wacky humor, and addictive gameplay that's perfect for playing with friends or by yourself. But hey, when it comes to LEGO games, that's exactly what we're looking for! So, let's get down to business.

The IGN critic says it best: "LEGO Marvel Super Heroes 2 doesn't deviate much from the established LEGO template... but its wide variety of settings, heroes, and abilities make it constantly fun to play, especially in co-op." And that's exactly what I found. The game is all about experimentation, trying out different characters and moves to see what works best for you.

GameSpot agrees: "Of course, these other activities aren't all enormous fun, but if you're a Marvel nut or a completionist (or both), then this game's basic cheerful gameplay and demeanor will make all of those extra pursuits worthwhile." And let's be real, who isn't a Marvel fan? It's like the ultimate guilty pleasure.

Gaming Age chimes in: "I'm a sucker for the LEGO games and toys, and of course Marvel, so this release is a no-brainer for me." Same here! Who wouldn't want to play as Iron Man, Captain America, or Spider-Man in a LEGO game?

And Cheat Code Central gives us a fun fact: "Lego Marvel Super Heroes 2's roster of over two hundred characters are sure to delight." That's what I call a superhero smorgasbord!

So, there you have it. LMHS2 is a fun, lighthearted romp that's perfect for players of all ages. It may not break new ground, but who needs innovation when the formula works? Trust me, this game will keep you entertained for hours on end.

And with that, I'm Hippo Penny out!
